docs.snippet: Brazilian Sports Minister Aldo Rebelo on Wednesday condemned Uruguayan forward Luis Suarez for appearing to bite an Italian opponent, saying "it was very bad" that the incident had taken place.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazilian Sports Minister Aldo Rebelo on Wednesday condemned Uruguayan forward Luis Suarez for appearing to bite an Italian opponent, saying "it was very bad" that the incident had taken place.

docs.snippet: Luis Suarez faces the prospect of a big financial hit following his alleged biting of Italian defender Giorgio Chiellini, with existing sponsorship deals potentially being ripped up and future endorsements put in jeopardy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suarez faces the prospect of a big financial hit following his alleged biting of Italian defender Giorgio Chiellini, with existing sponsorship deals potentially being ripped up and future endorsements put in jeopardy.

headline.main: Suarez Facing Big Financial Hit From Alleged Bite
headline.print_headline: Suarez Facing Big Financial Hit From Alleged Bite

docs.snippet: The race for the World Cup golden boot turned into a Barcelona battle Wednesday as Lionel Messi scored twice to lead Argentina to an entertaining 3-2 win over Nigeria and match Neymar's tournament-leading four goals in three games for Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: The race for the World Cup golden boot turned into a Barcelona battle Wednesday as Lionel Messi scored twice to lead Argentina to an entertaining 3-2 win over Nigeria and match Neymar's tournament-leading four goals in three games for Brazil.

headline.main: Club Teammates Messi, Neymar Top World Cup Scorers
headline.print_headline: Club Teammates Messi, Neymar Top World Cup Scorers

docs.snippet: Argentina’s Lionel Messi continued his World Cup dual with Neymar by scoring twice in a 3-2 win over Nigeria while Switzerland’s Xherdan Shaqiri got in on the act with a magnificent hat-trick in a 3-0 win over Honduras on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina’s Lionel Messi continued his World Cup dual with Neymar by scoring twice in a 3-2 win over Nigeria while Switzerland’s Xherdan Shaqiri got in on the act with a magnificent hat-trick in a 3-0 win over Honduras on Wednesday.

headline.main: Messi Shines Again and Shaqiri Joins the Fun
headline.print_headline: Messi Shines Again and Shaqiri Joins the Fun

docs.snippet: Ecuador coach Reinaldo Rueda called the red card given to midfielder Antonio Valencia "quite unfortunate," but declined to blame Ivory Coast referee Noumandiez Doue for Ecuador's exit from the World Cup after a 0-0 draw Wednesday against France.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ecuador coach Reinaldo Rueda called the red card given to midfielder Antonio Valencia "quite unfortunate," but declined to blame Ivory Coast referee Noumandiez Doue for Ecuador's exit from the World Cup after a 0-0 draw Wednesday against France.

headline.main: Ecuador Coach Declines to Blame Referee for Exit
headline.print_headline: Ecuador Coach Declines to Blame Referee for Exit

docs.snippet: Uruguay's President Jose Mujica weighed into the global controversy over footballer Luis Suarez on Wednesday, saying it was unfair to judge him retrospectively for biting an Italian player when other incidents went unreviewed.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's President Jose Mujica weighed into the global controversy over footballer Luis Suarez on Wednesday, saying it was unfair to judge him retrospectively for biting an Italian player when other incidents went unreviewed.

headline.main: Leave Suarez Alone, Uruguay President Urges
headline.print_headline: Leave Suarez Alone, Uruguay President Urges

docs.snippet: What the soccer players wear during their games now may soon influence fashion.
docs.lead_paragraph: What the soccer players wear during their games now may soon influence fashion.
docs.abstract: World Cup has spawned number of fashion trends, from haircuts to shoes to soccer jerseys worn out of context; many of same challenges encountered by menswear designers are shared by soccer uniform designers, who are well aware that their creations will be seen around world.

headline.seo: The World Cup a.k.a. One of the Largest Sports Fashion Catwalks

keywords.name: organizations

docs.snippet: If the Uruguay player Suárez is found to have bitten Giorgio Chiellini of Italy, he will face his third suspension in four years for biting an opposing player in a game.
docs.lead_paragraph: If the Uruguay player Suárez is found to have bitten Giorgio Chiellini of Italy, he will face his third suspension in four years for biting an opposing player in a game.
docs.abstract: FIFA disciplinary committee is investigating Uruguay striker Luis Suarez for apparently biting opponent in country's World Cup match against Italy; committee has broad authority to consider any evidence, including Suarez's past biting incidents, and determine any punishment.

headline.main: Panel on Suárez Can Weigh Past Incidents as It Decides Punishment
headline.print_headline: Panel on Suárez Can Weigh Past Incidents as It Decides Punishment

docs.snippet: An economist has developed a utilitarian index to determine which country’s victory would bring the most happiness.
docs.lead_paragraph: An economist has developed a utilitarian index to determine which country’s victory would bring the most happiness.
docs.abstract: The Upshot column; economist Dean Karlan offers utilitarian guide for determining which country's victory in 2014 World Cup would bring the most happiness.
